titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. C. M. Humston, Abstract
CWG8507

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: At a Circuit Court began and held for Henry County Ky at the Court House In the Town of New Castle on Monday September 1st 1862

Present Hon Geo C Drane Judge
Tuesday Sep 2" 1862

Present Hon I. N. Webb Judge Protem
Commonwealth of Ky
vs } On Motion
C. M. Humston

Upon the calling of this motion The atty for the Commth moved the Court for Judgement for the amount of all the excution mentioned in the Motion To Wit, The amt of $2360.27, together with 30 per cent therein for the faction of Said Humstons late Sheriff as aford to return them to the office of the Clerk of the Henry Circuit Court within the time prescribed by & Requierd by law and thereupon the Said Defd. C M Humston came into Court and pled guilty and confessed Judement for the amt claimed by the Commonwealth in manner and form as Set fourth in Said Notice and Motion Werefore it is adjudged by the Court that the Defd is guiltly as charge and that the Commonwth recover recover of Said Defd
The Sum of Two Thousand Three Hundred and Sixty Dollars. & 27, cents, and also Thirty percent on the amount of Execution Not returned in the time required by Law as confessed by Said Defd. Making the whole amount of this Judgment in favor the Comth $3068.27. cts for which the Commth may have Execution also her Cost here in Expended.
The following is the affidavit of C. M. Humston.

C. M. Humston States that the following Execution named in the notice to him of a motion in the name of Comwth against him in the Henry Circuit Court have been remited by the Governor of this State and and probably others not recollected.
The Commonwealth vs A Mahoney $18.60
Same vs F Roberts 288.00
Same vs A M Ballard 216.85
Same vs A Mahoney 148.60
Same vs B. W. Jenkins 70.90
Same vs James Stoubt 215.05
Same vs John McKenzie 106.50
Same vs Eword Turner 16.45
Same vs B. W. Jenkins 84.50
Same vs S Masterson 109.00
1331.50
30 per cent 339.45
$1670.95
C. M. Humston Says he believes the above State ment to be true

Sworn & Subscribed to by C M Humston before me on this 3rd day of September 1861
C. A. Leonard Dep Clk
For Geo. L. Humston Clk H. C C

Wednesday September 3d 1862
Commwth of Ky
vs } On motion for failure to Return Execution
C. M. Humston

For cause Shown upon the affidavit of C M Humston filed in this Cause and on his motion it is ordered that the Judgement rendered herein on a former day of this term to the extent of $1670.95c be Set aside and to that Extent the motion is continued and the residue of Said Judgement stands in force and Execution may issue for $1397.32 cents

I George L. Humston Cerk of the Henry Circuit Court do Certify that the above is a true copy of the proceeding in the Case of the Cmwth of Ky vs C M Humston at the September Term of the Henry Circuit Cout 1862

Witness my Hand this 16 September 1862
Geo. L. Humston C. H. C. C.

Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs
C M. Humston
Late Sheriff of Henry County
Copy,
September 16" 1862
